healthErrors.errorMessage: No successful test failover has been done on the virtual machine 'FAX-BBB2'.
healthErrors.possibleCauses: No successful test failover has been done on the virtual machine after it was replicated.
healthErrors.recommendedAction: Do a test failover on the virtual machine.

healthErrors.errorMessage: The data change rate (write bytes/sec) for '\\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0' has exceeded Azure Site Recovery supported limits.
healthErrors.possibleCauses:
The data change rate (observed for 60 mins) on the below disks of the virtual machine is more than the Azure Site Recovery supported limits for the target storage type.
      1. \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0
healthErrors.recommendedAction:
1. Review the Azure Site Recovery supported limits at https://aka.ms/asr-v2a-target-limits. Ensure that the target storage type (Standard or Premium) is provisioned as per the churn rate requirement at source.  Learn how to upgrade https://aka.ms/upgrade-to-premium
      2. If you are already replicating to a premium disk, ensure that the size of disk supports the observed churn rate. Learn how to resize replica disk at https://aka.ms/increase-asrseeddisk-size
      3. If the observed churn is temporary, wait for a few hours for the pending data upload to catch up and to create recovery points
healthErrors.summaryMessage: Data change rate beyond supported limits

healthErrors.errorMessage: No crash consistent recovery point available for the VM in the last 60 minutes.
healthErrors.possibleCauses:
1. Replication is delayed due to network connectivity issues or low bandwidth availability.
      2. Process server is not able to achieve the required bandwidth. Check Process server related alerts.
      3. The data change rate (write bytes/sec) for one or more disks of the source machine has exceeded Azure Site Recovery supported limits. Refer https://aka.ms/asr-v2a-target-limits.
healthErrors.recommendedAction:
Ensure that:
      1. Network connectivity exists between the source machine and the process server, between the source machine and the appliance and also between the Process server and Azure storage account.
      2. There is sufficient network bandwidth available between the source machine and the process server, and the process server and Azure.
      3. Ensure that the target storage type (Standard or Premium) is provisioned as per the churn rate requirement at source.
      4. Look for any associated events in the Azure Site Recovery events table and also any errors on the Server Replication vault overview blade, and resolve them if any.
      5. If the issue persists contact support.
healthErrors.summaryMessage: Recent crash consistent recovery point not available

healthErrors.errorMessage: No application consistent recovery point available for the VM in the last 510 minutes.
healthErrors.possibleCauses:
1. Replication is delayed due to network connectivity issues or low bandwidth availability.
      2. If the source machine is Windows, Azure Site Recovery VSS provider is missing or a VSS writer is causing application consistent snapshot failures.
      3. The data change rate (write bytes/sec) for one or more disks of the source machine has exceeded Azure Site Recovery supported limits. Refer https://aka.ms/asr-v2a-target-limits.
healthErrors.recommendedAction:
1. Ensure that the target storage type (Standard or Premium) is provisioned as per the churn rate requirement at source.
      2. For troubleshooting refer https://aka.ms/v2a_app-consistency-failure
      3. If you do not need application consistency for this source machine, update the replication policy to have app consistency frequency of zero.
      4. If the issue persists contact support.
healthErrors.summaryMessage: Recent app-consistent recovery point not available

healthErrors.errorMessage: No heartbeat received from the mobility service on the source machine 'FAX-BBB2' in the last 15 minutes.

innerHealthErrors.errorMessage: Replication service of the ASR Replication appliance drt-fax-asr failed to replicate the recent changes for the machine FAX-BBB2.
innerHealthErrors.possibleCauses: Latest changes for the machine FAX-BBB2 could not be detected by the ASR Replication appliance drt-fax-asr.
innerHealthErrors.recommendedAction:
Ensure that:
      1) Mobility Service Agent is running on the source machine. Learn more https://aka.ms/check-services
      2) Process server of the ASR Replication appliance drt-fax-asr is running and is in a healthy state.
      3) Source machine is able to communicate to the ASR replication appliance. Learn more https://aka.ms/check-connectivity

healthErrors.possibleCauses:
1) The mobility service is not running on the source machine.
      2) There is no network connectivity from the source machine to the ASR replication Appliance .
      3) Certificates needed by Azure Site Recovery are expired.
healthErrors.recommendedAction:
Ensure that -
      1) Mobility service is running on the source machine. To check,
       a) on Windows OS:
          Login with administrative privileges on your source machine. Navigate to "Services.msc" and ensure that the service "InMage Scout VX Agent - Sentinel/Outpost" is running. If not, then right click on the service and select "Start".
       b) on Linux OS distributions Debian 9, Debian 10, Oracle Linux 8, SUSE Linux 15, Ubuntu 20.04:
          Login as root user on your source machine. Run 'systemctl status vxagent' to check if service is running. If not, run 'systemctl start vxagent' to start it.
       c) on other Linux OS distributions:
          Login as root user on your source machine. Run 'service status vxagent' to check if service is running. If not, run 'service start vxagent' to start it.
      2) The source machine has network connectivity to the ASR replication appliance on the TCP port 443.
      Read more at https://aka.ms/asr-v2a-no-heartbeat.
      4) If above doesn’t resolve the issue, refer  https://aka.ms/AgentHealthCriticalRecommendations

healthErrors.errorMessage: VSS writer failed for an application. App consistency recovery points cannot be generated.
healthErrors.possibleCauses: VSS writer SqlServerWriter failed with error 0x800423f4 during After DoSnapshotSet phase on the source machine.
healthErrors.recommendedAction:
1. For common issues, refer https://aka.ms/vss-writer-failures.
      2. Please contact application vendor(s) for issue resolution.

healthErrors.errorMessage: Data upload blocked for the FAX-BBB2 '\\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0' disk's replication on the source machine.
healthErrors.possibleCauses:
1) The process server has not received any data from the source machine in the last 30 minutes.
      2) Certificates needed by Azure Site Recovery are expired.
healthErrors.recommendedAction:
Ensure that the network connectivity exists between the source machine and the process server. ​
      1. Check to see if the mobility service (InMage Scout VX Agent - Sentinel/Outpost, InMage Scout Application Service) is running on the source server.​
      2. Check if the port used for data transport (default is 9443) is not blocked by firewall rules.​
      Refer to https://aka.ms/source-to-ps-connectivity to learn how to troubleshoot this issue further.​
      3. If above doesn’t resolve the issue, refer  https://aka.ms/AgentHealthCriticalRecommendations

agentUpgradeBlockingErrorDetails.errorMessage: The Mobility agent of source machine 'FAX-BBB2' cannot be updated.
agentUpgradeBlockingErrorDetails.possibleCauses: The Mobility agent of source machine 'FAX-BBB2' is already on latest version '9.65.7417.1'.
agentUpgradeBlockingErrorDetails.recommendedAction: No action is needed as agent is already on the latest version.
